intro: Aquilegia vulgaris subsp. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular columbine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features distinctive spurred flowers that are typically blue or purple, with five petals and two elongated nectar-rich spurs. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, often with glandular dots on the underside. It thrives in woodland and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Its showy blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to native gardens.
